Patch Set 10:

(1 comment)
Will need to bump the schema, still think we are waiting on Redfish. ;)

I.e. I think we will need 1_5_0 
Which today only
Session
[csdl] [json-schema] [yaml]	v1.4.0
https://redfish.dmtf.org/schemas/Session.v1_4_0.json

> Will need to bump the schema, still think we are waiting on Redfish

You mean hypothetically, if Redfish released a standard with a new Context parameter in it, we would need to bump this.  We'll have to see what new presents we get in 2022.2 😊

Oh look, Redfish added support for something like this.  How helpful of them:

https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/bmcweb/+/57360/13/static/redfish/v1/schema/Session_v1.xml

Will get this patch updated and tested shortly.
Done

Lets keep IBM Oem as well. This will have impacts on the backward compatibility of the management client who is depending on many use-cases based on this OEM attribute. We can remove it along with the other ibm/v1 feature removal activity.
ACK
Done.  Latest patchset preserves the functionality.

Sunitha,

Is this something you can run through the IBM use cases and make sure nothing is broken?

As long as we have ClientId returned as IBM Oem, no use case will break on IBM systems. 
But in any case, we will pull this commit and test our scenarios. Code changes looks good.

>As long as we have ClientId returned as IBM Oem, no use case will break on IBM systems. 

Can we remove the OpenBMC OEM if it's implemented in IBM OEM?
Sorry Ed for causing confusions. This OEM is under OpenBMC and we need that for backward compatibility

What's the path and timeframe to getting this OEM parameter removed now that we have it covered by the standard?

Have you had a chance to test this patch against your use cases yet?

I talked with Gunnar a little, and I think I understand the timeline.

In terms of testing against IBM use cases would you prefer we merge this without IBM-specific testing, and you guys follow up if it causes bugs in the IBM namespaces?  I'm fine if that's what you guys want to do.

Sunitha, is a month okay? 
So after this merges, we can remove the OEM in a month ?
This commit does not break anything for IBM systems. We verified that. This can get merged and we can remove the OEM within this year.

>  OEM within this year

By end of 2022? I find that reasonable
